answers.body:
1. Data that's captured in GA already WON'T BE AFFECTED by the filters. They're not retroactive.

  2. If you want to remove fbclid then use the query string parameter exclusion feature: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/1010249?hl=en

You can exclude that parameter from the View settings, you don't need a filter:

However, as XTOTHEL says, the change will work from the day of saving onwards, not for historical data.

Note: fbclid is not an UTM parameter. It comes from Facebook posts link.

Real UTM parameters (utm_source, utm_medium, ...) are automatically removed from Google Analytics

items.title: Google Analytics Advanced filter to Combine / merge multiple instances of URL? Find & Replace UTM parameters
items.body:
I'm looking to use Advanced Filter Search and Replace on GA to combine all url instances of my blog page (multiple UTM parameters)

so Urls like the following:

/blogs/in-the-garden/diy-garden-bar-ideas-for-summer?mc_cid=etc..... /blogs/in-the-garden/diy-garden-bar-ideas-for-summer?fbclid=etc.....

I want to filter as: /blogs/in-the-garden/diy-garden-bar-ideas-for-summer

This is the plan for my filter:

Request URI Field A: ^(/blogs/in-the-garden/diy-garden-bar-ideas-for-summer)(?).*

Request URI Output To: $A1

Is this written correctly? I'm new to Reg Ex
